intro: Lebeckia microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf lebeckia, is a low-growing, succulent plant native to South Africa. It features small, fleshy, dark green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, allowing it to store water efficiently. The plant produces delicate, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in arid climates.
